trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when there is a problem communicating with the security token service.
The problem can be caused by the following conditions: (1) Network failure (2) Failure to reach the MEX endpoint (3) Security token service does not have a valid endpoint identity
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.StsCommunicationException"></xref> class.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.StsCommunicationException"></xref> class with the specified error message.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error.
The content of the message should also be understandable to the user.
The message that describes the error.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.StsCommunicationException"></xref> class with serialized data.
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object that contains the serialized object data about the exception that is being thrown.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> object that contains contextual information about the source or destination.

Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.StsCommunicationException"></xref> class with the specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The message that describes the error.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.
